conclusion: To solve the problem, the flow direction of liquid from containers A, B, C, and D through the baffles to containers E, F, and G will be analyzed.
The image shows containers labeled A, B, C, and D connected by baffles to containers E, F, and G, with flow paths illustrated using different colors.
The problem involves liquid flowing from containers A, B, C, and D through baffles into containers E, F, and G, and predicting which container the liquid will flow into.
The yellow path leads from D to F.
The blue path leads from C to G.
The white path leads from B to E.
The black path leads from A to G.
The yellow path leads from D to F, indicating liquid flowing from D into F.
The blue path leads from C to G, indicating liquid flowing from C into G.
The white path leads from B to E, indicating liquid flowing from B into E.
The black path leads from A to G, indicating liquid flowing from A into G.
Liquid from B flows into E.
Liquid from C flows into G.
Liquid from A flows into G.

Based on the paths indicated by color, liquid from A, B, C, and D will flow into containers E, F, and G. Specifically, liquid from B will flow into E, liquid from C will flow into G, and liquid from A will also flow into G.
Containers E, F, and G will receive liquid from A, B, C, and D.
